Articles.Content:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMMvJGs2FGQ

Something I made last night.

Any feedback? Also, if anyone is wondering, it was of course Jebediah descending the ladder.
That was one of, if not the, bet KSP video I've seen. Love the shots of previous missions in the background while he was climbing down the ladder.
Very nicely done! The choice of music was particularly apt. What was the track, BTW? I'm sure I've heard it somewhere, but can't remember where.
Absolutely beautiful. Tears came to my eyes

What was the track, BTW? I'm sure I've heard it somewhere, but can't remember where.

It's Magnificent Journey by Sound Adventures.
Not ganna cry, Im not ganna cry...
Pretty awesome. I started laughing in beginning because it kinda builds the drama up for the first steps on the mun. +1
This was amazingly done Rascal! Excellent choice of music and fantastic editing!
That was just a recording of some stuff that happened in a game, yet it had more emotional substance and impact than most of what comes out of professional movie studios.
I love that last shot. It's vaguely Kubrick, with a touch of Forrest Gump. Brilliant!

Wow.

Simply wow. That was frankly rather beautiful.

Especially liked the last shot as our brave hero jets off to the horizon becoming another pinprick of light in the field of stars.

Very Cool!!!

You might want to consider directing mate:)

Look forward to your future vids.

Wow, beautiful! You've just inspired me.

Once IVA's are up and running I want to recreate this: http://youtu.be/clG_1sqOsBs

Very Cool!!!

You might want to consider directing mate:)

You know, I've thought about pursuing careers like that, be it directing like you said or something like writing or what not, but I've decided at this point I'm going to pursue a career in astrophysics.

That said, thank you!
Very nice, I like the way you had other scenes going in the background, it added that extra bit of backstory.

This is the most awesome video I ever seen .

I hope you will make more awesome vids.
Great video. I like the dramatic music with the flashbacks of his mission
